import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8,6))
ax = df['Gender'].value_counts().plot(kind='bar', ax=ax)

plt.show()

ax.set_title('User Behavior Class vs Gender')
plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group the data by Operating System and calculate the mean Battery Drain
battery_drain_by_os = df.groupby('Operating System')['Battery Drain (mAh/day)'].mean().reset_index()

# Create the bar chart
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.bar(battery_drain_by_os['Operating System'], battery_drain_by_os['Battery Drain (mAh/day)'])
plt.xlabel('Operating System')
plt.ylabel('Battery Drain (mAh/day)')
plt.title('Battery Drain by Operating System')
plt.show()

instruction: A dataset contains these columns: ['User ID', 'Device Model', 'Operating System', 'App Usage Time (min/day)', 'Screen On Time (hours/day)', 'Battery Drain (mAh/day)', 'Number of Apps Installed', 'Data Usage (MB/day)', 'Age', 'Gender', 'User Behavior Class']                     python code to do the following : User Engagement. Tips: Use matplotlib library to create the plot and assume I already have the library installed.                     only givem me the code else I will kill someone if you give extra information or anything else.                     Please write ALL the code needed since it will be extracted directly and run from your response. output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Calculate user engagement as the sum of App Usage Time and Screen On Time
df['User Engagement'] = df['App Usage Time (min/day)'] + df['Screen On Time (hours/day)'] * 60

# Plot the distribution of user engagement
plt.hist(df['User Engagement'], bins=50)
plt.xlabel('User Engagement (min/day)')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Distribution of User Engagement')
plt.show()

# Plot the top 10 devices with highest average user engagement
top_devices = df.groupby('Device Model')['User Engagement'].mean().sort_values(ascending=False).head(10)
plt.bar(top_devices.index, top_devices.values)
plt.xlabel('Device Model')
plt.ylabel('Average User Engagement (min/day)')
plt.title('Top 10 Devices with Highest Average User Engagement')
plt.show()

# Plot the top 10 operating systems with highest average user engagement
top_os = df.groupby('Operating System')['User Engagement'].mean().sort_values(ascending=False).head(10)
plt.bar(top_os.index, top_os.values)
plt.xlabel('Operating System')
plt.ylabel('Average User Engagement (min/day)')
plt.title('Top 10 Operating Systems with Highest Average User Engagement')
plt.show()
'''

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Create a grouped dataframe for Age distribution by Gender
age_gender_df = df.groupby(['Gender', 'Age']).size().reset_index(name='Count')

# Pivot the dataframe to create a suitable format for plotting
age_gender_pivot = age_gender_df.pivot(index='Age', columns='Gender', values='Count')

# Create a bar plot
age_gender_pivot.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10,6))

# Show the plot
plt.show()

python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group the data by 'Device Model' and 'User Behavior Class', then count the number of users
behavior_breakdown = df.groupby(['Device Model', 'User Behavior Class']).size().reset_index(name='Count')

# Pivot the data to create a pivot table
pivoted_breakdown = behavior_breakdown.pivot(index='Device Model', columns='User Behavior Class', values='Count').fillna(0)

# Plot the breakdown
pivoted_breakdown.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10,6))
plt.title('User Behavior Class Breakdown by Device Model')
plt.xlabel('Device Model')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.show()
'''
